channel.title: openssl on Tanishq Chaudhary

item.title: How to: OpenSSL cap_setuid+ep PrivEsc Exploit
item.description: Consider the binary /usr/bin/openssl has capabilities set as the following. /usr/bin/openssl = cap_setuid+ep Is there a way to become root from a normal user by using this? YES! Let’s explore how. Checklist: Will It Work For Me? Search all the binaries' capibilities using: getcap -r / 2>/dev/null. Explaination: getcap is the tool we will use -r is the recursive flag 2>/dev/null directs the standard error stream to /dev/null If you see /usr/bin/openssl = cap_setuid+ep, we are set for success.
